context_evidences: - On April Fool’s Day, Twitter tweeted that it was working on an edit button . Thankfully, it was just a joke. But things have gotten a bit more serious this week: Elon Musk bought 9.2% of Twitter for $3 billion and took a board seat . Then, he asked his 80.5 million followers if they would like an edit button. Reference: https://techcrunch.com/2022/04/05/twitter-edit-button-elon-musk/ published on 2022-04-05 15:23:17

- Twitter Blue, the platform’s subscription product, already has a feature that delays the publication of a tweet by a few seconds (users can choose for how long) — before that time period elapses, you can hit an “undo” button, which lets you go back and edit the Tweet before it actually posts. For issues as ordinary as typos, this feature enough should suffice. But if Musk’s followers get their way and Twitter creates an edit button… now that’s something we will actually lose sleep over. Reference: https://techcrunch.com/2022/04/05/twitter-edit-button-elon-musk/ published on 2022-04-05 15:23:17
correction_response: This tweet is misleading. Elon Musk, despite being a prominent figure in tech, does not have the authority to change Twitter's interface, including the color of the Like button. This is under the control of Twitter's development team.
note_1_text: Even if the color of the Like button changed (which it has not, as any Twitter user can easily verify), Elon Musk is not responsible. Musk's purchase of Twitter has not been completed and some doubt it will ever happen.     https://apnews.com/article/elon-musk-twitter-deal-3dacbf6d930acaccc425846f859b7138
note_2_text: Elon Musk did not change the color of the like button. This is a copypasta tweet going around to get likes.
queries:
1. Did Elon Musk change the like button color?
2. Elon Musk's influence on social media features
3. News about Elon Musk changing the like button color
tweet_category: Technology, Social Media, and Big Tech
tweet_text: No wayyyy Elon Musk Changed the Like button color 😂
